exam_name: AIEED - All India Entrance Examination for Design

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
ARCH College of Design & Business will release the AIEED application form 2025 at aieed.com. Candidates interested in participating in AIEED screening for design studies must complete the online registration process before the deadline. Candidates can select their preferred date to appear for the AIEED entrance exam. 

As per AIEED eligibility, Students who have appeared for/ or cleared class 10+2 (CBSE/ICSE/IB/State Board/NIOS or equivalent as per UGC Guidelines) are eligible to participate in the AIEED Screening for Design Studies. Class 10+1 Students can also write AIEED 2025, and qualifying students will be eligible for direct admission in the academic year 2026 after clearing the interaction and PoA stage.

AIEED consists of three stages - General Aptitude Test (GAT), the Creative Aptitude Test (CAT), and Interaction. Students who completed the registration process before the deadline will be issued an AIEED 2025 admit card.  Candidates are advised to check the AIEED exam pattern 2025 beforehand to prepare for the entrance exam effectively. 

AIEED 2025 results will be declared at least seven days after the conclusion of all the stages of the AIEED examination.

About AIEED

All India Entrance Examination for Design (AIEED) is a national-level exam conducted by the ARCH Academy of Design for admission to undergraduate courses available at their Delhi and Jaipur campuses. The exam is conducted on various dates for admission to fashion and design programmes and is held in two stages - General Ability Test (GAT) and Creative Ability Test (CAT).

highlights.value: All India Entrance Examination for Design

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To be eligible for UG and PG programmes at AIEED, candidates need to meet the following AIEED 2025 eligibility criteria: 

For Undergraduate Course

  • Candidates who have either passed their 10+2 examination or are currently in class 11 are eligible to take the entrance exam. 

  • Its essential that candidates must have passed or be appearing for the qualifying exam from specific board such as

    • Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE)

    • Indian Certificate of Secondary Education (ICSE)

    • International Baccalaureate (IB)

    • National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS) or equivalent as per UGC Guidelines are eligible for AIEED screening for design studies. 

For Postgraduate Course

  • Candidates holding a bachelor's degree in any discipline from the recognised university can apply for postgraduate courses.

application_process.html_content:
AIEED Application form 2025 notification will be announced by the ARCH College of Design & Business at aieed.com. To complete the AIEED 2025 application form, candidates need to fill the form with all required details, selecting the preferred exam date, upload the documents and pay the application fee of Rs.3000. The AIEED 2025 registration last date will be updated along with official notification. Candidates will be able to pay the AIEED application fee by using the debit card, credit card, or by using any online payment gateway. 

How to fill the AIEED application form 2025 

Candidates can follow the below steps to fill the AIEED 2025 registration form:

  • Candidates need to register first 

  • Sign by giving the details like name, email id, mobile number, city and select the course level and course and submit the form. 

  • Candidates need to login register form by giving the email and password

  • Fill the AIEED registration form by providing the personal and academic details 

  • Upload the required documents and pay the application fee.

admit_card.html_content:
The AIEED admit card will be issued by the ARCH academy of design. The AIEED 2025 admit card will be issued two-three days before the exam date. Candidates can download their admit card from the official website.  

Steps to download AIEED admit card 2025

  • Visit aieed.com
  • Click on the link to download the AIEED 2025 admit card 
  • Login using ‘Control Number’ and ‘Password’
  • Upon successful login, the hall ticket of AIEED 2025 will be displayed on the screen
  • Download and take a printout of the same.

counselling_process.html_content:
ARCH design college will conduct AIEED 2025 counselling after the announcement of results. The AIEED counselling dates 2025 will be published on the official website - aieed.com. The AIEED counselling process is the second step in the AIEED selection process. After the completion of AIEED screening for design test, the authorities will conduct the AIEED counselling process 2025. A separate counselling process of AIEED 2025 will be conducted for both undergraduate and postgraduate design degrees.  Candidates who will qualify the AIEED screening test will be eligible for AIEED counselling.

Eligibility for counselling is determined based on the applicant’s AIEED 2025 results, interview performance, academic record, and portfolio. Following the counselling process, applicants will be allocated seats for their desired academic programs based on their merit rank. It is mandatory for qualifying and selected applicants to attend the counselling session at the ARCH Academy of Design Campus on the designated date and time.

Remember that participating in the AIEED 2025 counselling procedure does not guarantee admission; acceptance into the chosen design program depends on merit. Ensure that you meet all eligibility criteria and provide the necessary documents during the counselling process for a smooth experience.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
ARCH College of Design & Business will specify the AIEED 2025 exam pattern at aieed.com. The AIEED 2025 consists of three parts:  PED screening, CATA screening, and POA & SoP. Candidates can check the complete details of AIEED 2025 exam pattern from the table below:

exam_name: NIFT Entrance Exam - National Institute of Fashion Technology Entrance Examination
conducting_body: National Institute of Fashion Technology, Delhi

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
NIFT entrance Exam 2025: The National Institute of Fashion Technology 2025 entrance exam is conducted by the National Testing Agency for UG & PG design courses. NIFT 2025 notification will be released tentatively in November 2024. Candidates aspiring seats in the design programme need to appear for the NIFT entrance exam for the year 2025-26 session. To appear for the NIFT 2025 entrance exam candidates must fill the application form before the deadline. 

NIFT offers various design programmes such as B.Des, B.F.Tech, M.Des, M.F.M and M.F.Tech. Candidates who want to pursue undergraduate programmes need to pass a 10+2 examination from recognised central and state boards. For postgraduate programmes, candidates need to have a bachelor's degree in the relevant field from a recognised university are eligible to apply for the exam. Candidates interested in these programmes need to apply and fill the application form for NIFT exam 2025. 

Before filling the NIFT application form 2025, candidates need to review the eligibility criteria set by the exam authorities. Candidates who are eligible can apply for the NIFT 2025 entrance exam by paying the application fee. NIFT 2025 application form release date will be announced on its official website - nift.ac.in. The last date for NIFT application form 2025 will be informed by the authorities along with official notification. 

Latest News and Updates of NIFT exam 2025 

The National Testing Agency will release the NIFT notification 2025 on its official website. The NIFT application form 2025 will be released likely in November 2024. 

NIFT admit card will be released by the National testing Agency likely in January 2025. The NIFT 2025 admit card will be available on the NIFT admission portal - nift.ac.in. Candidates who completed the NIFT registration form 2025 can download the admit card using the login credentials (application number and password).  NIFT hall ticket is the important document that needs to be carried by the student to the exam center along with any government-approved ID proof.

NIFT result 2025 will be declared by the exam conducting authorities on its official website - nift.ac.in. NIFT results will be released likely in March 2025. To check the NIFT 2025 result, candidates must visit the official website and use the login credentials such as the application number and password. Candidates who qualify for the NIFT CAT and GAT exams must appear for the next exam called as the NIFT situation test. The NIFT situation test will be conducted tentatively in April, 2025. 

After the situation test, the authorities will release the NIFT final result in May 2025 for all UG and PG courses. Selected Candidates will be able to participate in the NIFT counselling and seat allotment process to obtain admission into the NIFT campuses. NIFT 2025 counselling process involves various steps such as registration, choice filling, locking of choices, seat allotment and payment of fees. The authorities will release the NIFT seat allotment results for each round as per availability of seats. 

About NIFT entrance exam 

National Institute of Fashion Technology  is a national level entrance exam conducted annually. NIFT full form stands for National Institute of Fashion Technology. NIFT offers various design programmes such as  Bachelors of Design (B.Des), Bachelors of Fashion Technology (B.F.Tech), Masters of Design (M.Des), Masters of Fashion Technology (M.F.Tech), and Masters of Fashion Management (M.F.M). NIFT 2025 entrance exam will be conducted in pen and paper mode. Candidates who will be selected in these design programmes will be able to gain admission in any of the 18 NIFT campuses.

highlights.value: National Institute of Fashion Technology Entrance Examination

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates must meet the NIFT entrance exam eligibility requirement before filling the application form. Mentioned below are the detailed information regarding NIFT eligibility criteria 2025 for each programme.

For B.Des & B.F.Tech Programme: 

  • Age Qualification: Candidates should have age less than 24 years as on August 1 of the admission year. Candidates belonging to reserved category (SC/ST/PwD) will have an age relaxation of 5 years. 

  • Academic Qualification:  Candidates must pass the 10+2 from a recognised central or state board/ National Open School with a minimum of five subjects/  Public School/Board/University Examination in India or in foreign countries recognized by the Association of Indian Universities as equivalent to 10+2 system.

For M.Des & M.F.M Programme:

  • Age Qualification: There is no age limit for M.Des & M.F.M Programme.

  • Academic Qualification: Candidates who completed their undergraduate degree in any stream from a recognized institute or university. Candidates who passed their 3 year diploma undergraduate course under NIFT/NID.  

For M.F.Tech programme: 

  • Age Qualification: There is no age limit for M.F.Tech Programme 

  • Academic Qualification: Candidates who completed their B.F.Tech from National Institute of Fashion Technology (NIFT) or B.E/B.Tech. from any recognized Institute / University.

application_process.html_content:
NTA will release the NIFT application form on its official website - exams.nta.ac.in/NIFT. The exact date for NIFT 2025 application form is not yet announced. The NIFT registration form will be released likely in November 2024. The authorities will notify the NIFT 2025 application form last date on the official notification. Candidates need to carefully read all the guidelines specified by the authorities before applying for NIFT exam 2025. 

How to apply for NIFT 2025 registration form? 

Candidates who fulfil all the required NIFT entrance exam eligibility criteria need to apply. Here are the steps for filling the NIFT application form 2025: 

  • Students should go to the official website - exams.nta.ac.in/NIFT or nift.ac.in

  • Register and generate the ID and password to fill the details.

  • Relogin and fill the NIFT 2025 application form.

  • Upload all required documents.

  • Pay the application fee of NIFT and download.

  • Take the printout for further NIFT admission process.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Preparing for the NIFT entrance exam can be challenging for design aspirants. Candidates are advised to check the tips given below to prepare well for the exam:

  • Practice Drawing: Regularly work on the drawing and sketching skills will improve the accuracy. 

  • Stay Updated: Keep up with the latest fashion trends and industry news to enhance the general knowledge.

  • Solve Past Papers: Practice with previous years' question papers to understand the exam pattern and improve time management.

  • Take Mock Tests: Participate in mock tests to build confidence and identify areas that need improvement.

  • Boost Creativity: Engage in activities that enhance the creativity and visualisation skills, essential for the design aptitude sections.

admit_card.html_content:
The National Testing Agency will issue the NIFT 2025 admit card on its NIFT admission portal - exams.nta.ac.in/NIFT, tentatively in January 2025. NTA NIFT admit card 2025 date is not yet announced by authorities. To download the NIFT 2025 admit card, candidates need to enter their login credentials generated while registration. NIFT admit card contains details such as name of the candidate, application number, exam centre name and address, date of birth, category, course name, exam centre code, reporting time and signature of the candidate. 

How to check the NIFT admit card 2025? 

Candidates can refer to the below steps to download the NIFT hall ticket 2025.

  • Go to the official NIFT website - nift.ac.in.

  • Locate and click on the 'NIFT Admit Card 2025' link.

  • Input the login credentials such as registered email address and date of birth.

  • Press the 'Submit' button.

  • Candidates can view the NIFT 2025 admit card on the screen.

  • Download the NIFT hall ticket 2025 and print it for future reference.

cutoffs.html_content:
The NIFT Cutoff will be released by the concerned authorities on its official website. The NIFT cutoff is the minimum score required for candidates to qualify for admission into various NIFT programs. It varies each year based on factors like the difficulty of the exam, number of candidates, and available seats. The NIFT cutoff 2025 will be released in the form of opening and closing ranking for various programmes for each category such as open, OBC- NC, SC, ST, PwD, NRI, EWS, Dom Open, Dom UR, Dom SC, SC PwD, and ST PwD. 

NIFT cutoffs are important for candidates which indicates the last rank at which admission is offered. Candidates who fail to achieve  rank equal to or higher than cutoff rank means they will not be able to secure admission in NIFT campus or course. The NIFT cut off list will be available online at NIFT admission portal.

counselling_process.html_content:
NIFT Counselling is a crucial step for students who will clear the NIFT entrance exam questions. During the counselling process, candidates are allocated seats in various NIFT campuses based on their ranks and preferences.

  • Registration: Candidates must register online for the NIFT counselling process.

  • Choice Filling: while registering for NIFT counselling, candidates need to select their preferred courses and NIFT campuses.

  • Document Verification: The authorities will verify the documents to confirm NIFT admission eligibility.

  • Seat Allotment: Seats will be allotted based on rank, preference, and availability.

  • Payment of Fees: After seat allotment, candidates must pay the required fees to confirm their NIFT admission.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
NIFT exam pattern will be prescribed by the NIFT authorities on its official brochure. Candidates must check the NIFT exam pattern to know about the type of questions, number of questions asked in each section, mode of the exam, and duration of the exam. The NIFT exam consists of two sections: General Ability Test (GAT) and Creative Ability Test (CAT). B.F.Tech

The exam pattern of NIFT entrance exam 2024 for the Creative Ability Test namely CAT has not been released by the authorities yet, Candidates are advsied to focus on concept development and design as questions will be designed to test them in these areas. They must be creative and make innovative use of their colour and illustration skills. 

Generally three questions are asked for a total of 30 marks and candidates are tested accordingly.

M.Des

NTA has announced the personal interview dates for M.Des programme on its official website -exams.nta.ac.in/NIFT/. To download the personal interview call letter, candidates can use their login credentials such as application number and date of birth. Qualified candidates can participate in personal interview from April 4 to April 6, 2024. 

NIFT 2024 Situation Test will be conducted for the shortlisted candidates of CAT and GAT for B.Des admissions. This will be held separately for those who have qualified. The situation test is a hands-on test used to evaluate the candidate’s skills for material handling as well as the innovative ability in a given situation with a given set of materials.

The Exam Pattern of the Situation Test can be summarised as follows:

  • Duration: two hours
  • Test involves: Design of one three dimensional (3D) model.

Note: Candidates will be provided with all the required design materials which should be checked by them upon receipt.

Some guidelines:

  • Candidates will be permitted to bring some items as instructed in the admit card
  • They must make optimum usage of the same. Additional materials will not be provided.
  • Colour pencils and marker pens are not allowed.
  • An Answer Sheet will be provided separately for any writing purposes which has to be signed by the candidates in the exam hall.
  • After completion of the test, the model, answer sheet and any left over materials must be left by the candidates on the table.

Evaluation Criteria for the NIFT Situation Test 2024 are as follows:

  • Originality of the concept applied.
  • Creative use of material and the skills for the same.
  • Neatness of the final model.
  • The write-up describing the model and concepts used.

exam_name: IICD Entrance Test - Indian Institute of Crafts and Design Entrance Test
conducting_body: Indian Institute of Crafts and Design

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Indian Institute of Crafts and Design is expected to release the IICD application form 2025 in March. The authorities of IICD will release the IICD admission dates 2025 schedule at its official website - iicd.ac.in. Candidates willing to seek admission to design courses should have a valid UCEED/NIFT/NID score or have qualified IICD entrance test 2025.

The IICD entrance exam will be conducted in 2 phases. Candidates must check the IICD eligibility criteria so as to proceed to fill out the application form. While filling out the IICD application form, the applicant must pay the application fee as Rs. 1750 online. Applicants registered successfully will be able to download the IICD admit card 2025 with the allotted user Id and password.

IICD 2025 Latest News and Updates

The authorities are expected to release the IICD 2025 notification for its admission soon on their official website - iicd.ac.in. The Indian Institute of Crafts and Design offers admissions into its Design courses.

Students who will be qualified based on the scores in entrance exam will be called for an interview. Finally, based on scores and interviews, a merit list will be released. 

About IICD

Indian Institute of Crafts and Design (IICD), Jaipur is the institute that fulfils the dream of the aspirants willing to pursue design courses. The admissions at IICD are provided based on the entrance exam results. The IICD conducts a university-level entrance exam to offer admission to students in the world of design. The students can opt for Bachelor of Design or Master of Design courses, respectively.

highlights.value: Indian Institute of Crafts and Design Entrance Test
Indian Institute of Crafts and Design

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The authorities will release the eligibility criteria of IICD 2025 along with the brochure. The IICD eligibility criteria 2025 include age limit, academic qualification, and more, etc to get admission into the design programmes. The applicants, before filling out the application form must ensure that they meet the IICD 2025 eligibility criteria. The IICD eligibility criteria 2025 are as follows.

B.Design: 

  • Candidates must have passed 10+2 from a recognised education board.

  • Candidates appearing for the qualifying exam are also eligible to apply.

M.Design:

  • Candidates must have passed graduation is design and architecture from a recognised institution/university.

  • Candidates appearing for the final year graduation examinations may also apply.

Note: There is no age limit for the candidates to apply for B.Des or M.Des courses.

application_process.html_content:
The Indian Institute of Crafts and Design, Jaipur is expected to release the IICD 2025 application form in October 2024. The IICD application form 2025 will be made available online at - iicd.ac.in. The last date to submit the IICD 2025 application form will be notified as per the schedules for Phase 1 and Phase 2. The applicants are advised to visit the official website - iicd.ac.in to register themselves and fill out the IICD application form 2025 online to appear for the IICD entrance exam. Before proceeding to fill out the IICD application form, the applicants must keep the following documents handy to complete the submission process.

  • Recent photograph

  • Scanned copy of 10th class mark sheet

  • Scanned copy of 12th class mark sheet 

  • Photo identity proof

  • Candidate’s signature

  • Category certificate (if applicable)

  • Disability certificate (if applicable)

Application Fees: The candidates are required to make an online payment of Rs.1,750 (Rs. One Thousand Seven Hundred Fifty only) as an application fee. The candidates to note that the application fee is non-refundable. 

Provided below are the steps to be followed when applying for the IICD entrance exam 2025.

  • Applicants to register themselves by providing their details.

  • Verify your email address.

  • Login credentials such as the User ID and Password are allotted.

  • Login and fill out the IICD application form 2025.

  • Upload the scanned documents and photograph.

  • Make payment of the application fee online.

  • Click on save and submit the application form.

preparation_tips.html_content:
For the candidates to through in the IICD entrance exam, it is necessary to follow some important preparation instructions given below.

  • Check the previous exam pattern, which includes the type of questions, marking scheme, and time allotted to each of the sections.

  • Make a note of the important headings.

  • Check if there is any change in the current exam pattern from the previous one. 

  • Regularly practice the sample questions.

  • Try to attempt the mock test if available.

admit_card.html_content:
The Indian Institute of Crafts and Design will issue the IICD admit card 2025 online. The registered candidates need to use the login credentials to download the IICD 2025 admit card. Candidates appearing for the IICD entrance exam must carry the printout of the IICD admit card 2025 along with an original valid photo Identity proof. The valid photo identity proof includes a Voter ID/passport/PAN card. The following details will be mentioned on the IICD 2025 admit card.

  • Candidate’s name

  • Roll number 

  • Application number

  • Course name

  • Exam venue and time 

  • Exam day instructions

How to download IICD 2025 admit card?

  • Visit iicd.ac.in
  • Click on the IICD admit card 2024 link 
  • Login using the email id and password 
  • Upon successful login, the result will be displayed on the screen.
  • Download and take a printout of the same.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The IICD exam pattern 2025 for the entrance exam will be specified by the authorities. The IICD  exam pattern includes the examination mode, concepts, and the weightage carried, etc. 

IICD Exam Pattern 2025

  • Part A is conducted to test the candidate’s abilities such as observation, synthesis, visual interpretation, and general awareness.

  • Part B (a) tests how intelligently the candidates use materials to conceptualize and realize a 3-dimensional form, the skill of handling material, and provides a solution for a given situation and a plan, and strategy. This also tests the ability to provide various solutions to the given problem with a written description.

  • Part B (b) is conducted to evaluate the candidate’s personality in terms of aptitude to crafts, intelligence quotient (IQ), communication ability, general awareness about crafts & design, and overall personal achievements in academics and co-curricular activities.

exam_name: CEED - Common Entrance Examination for Design

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
IIT Bombay announced the CEED exam dates on its official website - ceed.iitb.ac.in 2025.  According to the official notification, the CEED entrance exam date is January 19, 2025. Moreover, IITB CEED application form 2025 was released on October 1, 2024 at 1 PM. Aspiring candidates who want to pursue the postgraduate design courses at IITs need to fill the CEED 2025 application form before the deadline. The CEED 2025 registration last date is October 31, 2024. 

Students who wish to pursue the postgraduate design programme need to meet the CEED 2025 eligibility criteria. The CEED exam eligibility criteria 2025 is prescribed along with the brochure by IIT Bombay. Candidates interested in the M.Des programme need to have a degree or diploma or postgraduate degree after completing the 12th standard are eligible for admission to various institutes. 

Aspirants who are going to appear for CEED exam 2025 should check syllabus and exam pattern beforehand to get an idea on how the entrance exam will be held. CEED syllabus 2025 has been released at ceed.iitb.ac.in 2025. 

The exam authorities will issue the CEED admit card 2025 on January 3, 2025. Registered students will be able to download the CEED admit card by visiting their dashboard using the login credentials. Candidates are advised to check the details mentioned on the CEED hall ticket 2025 after downloading. Students need to bring the CEED 2025 admit card to the exam venue without fail. Failure to do so, candidates will not be allowed to enter the CEED examination hall. 

Latest News and Updates: CEED exam 2025 

The IIT Bombay released the CEED 2025 notification on October 1, 2024. CEED notification 2025 contains the all important dates and information related to the exam. 

About the CEED 2025 exam 

CEED full form stands for Common Entrance Exam for Design which is a national level examination conducted by IIT Bombay for postgraduate design admission for various institutions. CEED score is accepted by many various colleges offering M.Des programmes.  CEED examination 2025 comprises two parts such as Part A and Part B. CEED part A consists of objective type questions, while Part B consists of 5 questions. The weightage of CEED part A and part B are 25% and 75% respectively. Candidates who are interested in M.Des design course in IITs need to appear for CEED exam and attain the required cutoff to get admission in desired course.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates aspiring to apply for the CEED 2025 exam need to satisfy the CEED exam eligibility criteria specified by the conducting body. Candidates can check the CEED eligibility criteria 2025 from the list below: 

  • Applicants must pass the degree or diploma or postgraduate degree of minimum 3 years after intermediate or 12th standard are eligible for CEED exam. 

  • Students who appear for the final year examination can also apply for the exam, but the programme should be completed by July 2025. 

  • Candidates who qualified the GD arts diploma programme (10+5) by July 2025 of the academic year. 

  • There is no age limit to appear for CEED exam.

  •  A candidate can appear for CEED test any number of times.

application_process.html_content:
IIT Bombay CEED application form was released on October 1, 2024. Candidates must check the eligibility criteria of CEED 2025 before filling the CEED application form 2025. The last date to submit the CEED application form is October 31, 2024 as per the official notification. Candidates are advised to keep ready all the documents and scanned photocopies to fill the application form. Also, while filling the CEED application form, the applicants have to make the online payment of application fee according to the category they belong to.

What are the documents required to fill the CEED application form ? 

The following are the list of documents required to fill the CEED 2025 application form are listed below: 

  • Colour photograph with prescribed format

  • Scanned signature (jpeg.format)

  • Scanned copies of all certificates/ mark lists 

  • Caste certificate ( if applicable)

  • Physical disability certificates (If applicable) 

How to apply for the CEED 2025 application form?

Candidates need to fill the CEED application form by following this steps from the below:

  • Visit the official website of CEED - ceed.iitb.ac.in.

  • Fill the CEED application with required details 

  • Upload the scanned copies with prescribed format 

  • Pay the CEED application fee 

  • Submit the CEED registration form and take the print out. 

CEED Application fee 

Particulars

CEED application fee

Female candidates of all categories

Rs. 2000

Reserved category (SC/ST/PwD) candidates

Rs. 2000

All other candidates

Rs. 4000 

Note: Candidates should remember that the CEED application fee is non -refundable and non- transferable.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Candidates preparing for CEED (common entrance examination for design) need to make a strategic study plan to crack the exam. Candidates can check the below tips to prepare well for the exam. 

  • Candidates should familiarise themselves with the CEED exam pattern. 

  • Candidates can go through the syllabus, which covers all topics thoroughly includes visual perception, creativity, analytical reasoning, and design aptitude. 

  • Candidates should prepare their study schedule to cover all subjects and allot time for revision and practice. 

  • Students should enhance their drawing skills regularly as its crucial part of the design aptitude section

  • Candidates should regularly practise on previous year question papers and take mock tests to get confidence to understand the exam difficulty level and question format.

admit_card.html_content:
IITB CEED admit card will be issued on January 3, 2025. The CEED 2025 admit card will be available on its official website -  ceed.iitb.ac.in. Students who completed the CEED registration by paying the application fee before the last date can access the CEED hall ticket. To download the CEED admit card 2025, candidates can use their login credentials created during the registration of the CEED. Aspirants should carry the admit card along with the CEED exam centre to avoid the inconvenience. 

How to download the CEED 2025 admit card? 

Candidates who successfully completed the CEED 2025 registration form will be able to download the CEED hall ticket by following the below steps:

  • Go to the CEED official website - ceed.iitb.ac.in.

  • Find and click the ‘CEED admit card 2025’ tab 

  • Use the login credentials such as registered email id and password

  • The screen will be displayed with CEED admit card 

  • Take 2-3 copies of the CEED admit card for further references.

cutoffs.html_content:
The CEED cutoff is the minimum score that determines the eligibility of the candidate for admission for the design programme in the top design institution. The CEED cutoff will be released in the form of mean and standard deviation. According to the previous year trends, Part A mean and standard deviation are 41.90 and 16.72, respectively. The CEED cutoff scores will vary every year for different categories. Candidates can check the below table for last year's CEED cutoff for Part A.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
CEED exam pattern is prescribed by the conducting body at ceed.iitb.ac.in. With the help of the CEED 2025 exam pattern, candidates can familiarise themselves with the CEED syllabus. The CEED 2025 exam consists of two parts. CEED 2025 Part A is a computer based test and part B is the pen and paper mode. Candidates can know the details like type of question asked in the exam, difficulty level of the exam, topics and sections included in the exam, duration of the exam and many more.

CEED Part A contains three types of questions such as Numerical Answer Type (NAT),  Multiple Choice Question (MCQ), and Multiple Select Question (MSQ).  CEED part A question papers consists of following topics such as: 

  • Visualisation and spatial reasoning

  • Practical and scientific knowledge

  • Observation and design sensitivity

  • Environment and society

  • Analytical and logical reasoning

  • Language

  • Creativity

  • Art and Design knowledge

  • Design methods and practices

CEED Part B consists of five questions aimed to test design, drawing and writing skills. Refer the following topics from the questions asked for Part B question paper. 

  • Drawing 

  • Creativity 

  • Communication 

  • Problem Identification

CEED Exam pattern 2025

Exam Structure

Details

Two sections: Part A & Part B

Duration of exam 

3 hours (Part A - 1 hour & Part B - 2 hours)

Type of Questions

  • Numerical Answer Type (NAT)

  • Multiple Choice Question (MCQ) and 

  • Multiple Select Question (MSQ)

Total number of questions 

44

Medium

English

Total Marks 

  • Part A - 150

  • Part B - 100

exam_name: UPESDAT - UPES Design Aptitude Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) has released the application form of UPES DAT 2025. Candidates looking for UG design admission at UPES can apply for the design aptitude test at upes.ac.in. However, before applying for UPES design admission 2025, aspirants are advised to check the eligibility criteria laid down by the authorities. As per UPES DAT 2025 eligibility, aspirants who have obtained a minimum of 50% in class 10 and 12 are eligible for admissions. 

The authorities are expected to announce the UPES DAT 2025 exam date soon. Once the exam date for UPES DAT 2025 is announced, it will be updated on this page as well. Along with the UPES entrance exam, aspirants seeking admissions an also use NID/NIFT/UCEED and CUET scores for admission to UPES. 

The admit card for UPES DAT 2025 will be issued in online mode. Candidates have to download the UPES DAT 2025 admit card with the photograph affixed to produce it at the allotted test centre. 

Aspirants will be able to download the UPES DAT 2025 from the official website. The result will include details on the qualifying status along with the section-wise obtained scores. 

About UPES DAT

The University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES) conducts an online UPES Design Aptitude Test (DAT) for the admission aspirants seeking admission in design programs offered by the UPES School of Design. To secure admission to design programs at the University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), aspirants have a clear UPES DAT, interviews, and portfolio round.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The authorities have prescribed the UPES DAT eligibility criteria at the official website. The eligibility criteria of UPES DAT 2025 include conditions and requirements that students need to meet to be eligible for admission to the design course offered by UPES Dehradun.  The aspirants must meet the prescribed UPES DAT 2025 eligibility criteria. Candidates must go through the eligibility criteria of UPES DAT 2025 includes academic qualification and score that candidates need to score to be eligible for UPES DAT 2025.         

UPES DAT Eligibility Criteria for B.Des

The eligibility criteria specified for the B.Design programme is that the candidate must have passed their 10th and 12th class with 50% as the minimum score in any stream from any recognised board.

UPES DAT Eligibility Criteria for M.Des

The eligibility criteria for the M.Des programme are as follows.

  • The candidate must have passed their higher and senior secondary levels with a minimum 50% score in any stream from any recognised board.

  • Minimum 50% marks in bachelor’s degree in any stream: 10+2+3 years (B.Des./B.Arch./ B.Tech./ BFA graduates will be preferred)

  • Accepted valid CEED/NID/NIFT scores.

application_process.html_content:
The authorities have released the UPES DAT application form at upes.ac.in. Filling out the application form includes many steps such as registration,  personal details, academic details, uploading documents and payment of application fee. Candidates to follow the below-mentioned steps to fill UPESDAT application form 2025. The steps help them to fill out the form with ease.

UPESDAT 2025 Registration/ Application Form Process

Step 1 -  Registration - Candidates have visit the official website and click on the link for registration.     

Step 2 -  Personal Details - A new page will appear where candidates have to enter their personal details, such as first name, last name, level, select the program,  email ID, date of birth, and mobile number.     

Step 3  - Academic Details - Students must fill in class 10 and 12 details, such as year of passing and percentage in the UPES DAT application form. If they appear for the 12th exam, they have to mark yes in the specified box.    

Step 4  - Other Important Details - In this section of the UPESDAT application form 2025,  they have to mention nationality, country, state, city, and application pathway. Enter the captcha code, checkmark the ‘I have read and understood the eligibility criteria, and click on the submit button.    

 Step 5  - Enter the OTP - Enter the OTP and then candidates will receive their application number on their screen and the user name and password will be sent to their phone.        

Step 6 - Uploading of documents - Next, upload required documents as per specifications mentioned by the authorities. 

 Step    7 – Payment of UPESDAT Application Fee - After this, click on Proceed to Pay button, take the printout and keep it for future reference.

admit_card.html_content:
The authorities will issue the UPESDAT 2025 admit card a few days before the entrance exam. The admit card for UPESDAT 2025 will be issued in online mode - upes.ac.in. Candidates have to download the admit card with the photograph affixed and produce it at the allotted test centre. Candidates without the admit card will not be allowed to appear in the exam. 

Steps to download UPESDAT Admit Card 2025

  • Visit upes.ac.in
  • Click on the link to download hall ticket 
  • Login using the application number and password
  • Upon successful login, the admit card of UPESDAT 2025 will be displayed on the screen 
  • Download and take a printout of the same. 

The details mentioned on the admit card are-

  • Candidate's name
  • UPESDAT 2025 roll number
  • Exam date
  • Exam time
  • UPES DAT test centre address
  • Instructions for the exam

cutoffs.html_content: UPES will announce the UPESDAT cutoff 2025 for admissions to B.Des soon after the declaration of the result. Candidates need to secure the minimum cut off marks for admission to B.Des and M.Des courses offered by UPES. Those who secure the minimum cut off will be called for the interview.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
Candidates appearing for the UPESDAT 2025 exam are advised to check the exam pattern beforehand. The UPESDAT for B.Des will be conducted online and the type of questions asked will be objective-type multiple-choice questions. The exam will be for one hour. Students must go through the exam pattern to know the marking scheme and get familiar with the subject and topic-wise weightage, how many questions will be asked, and the section of questions. 

The test takes will also come to know about the medium of the exam.

exam_name: SMEAT - Srishti Manipal Entrance and Aptitude Test
conducting_body: Srishti Institute of Art Design and Technology

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Srishti Manipal Institute of Art, Design, and Technology will release the SMEAT admission notification in January 2025. SMEAT (Srishti Manipal Entrance and Aptitude Test) is the entrance test conducted by Srishti Manipal Institute to provide admissions into its design courses. The authorities will release the SMEAT application form 2025 online at srishtimanipalinstitute.in, the official website. The SMEAT 2025 exam dates are yet to be released.

The applicants are advised to carefully check the SMEAT eligibility criteria 2025 as it is different for each programme. The application fee has to be paid as Rs. 2000/- while filling out the SMEAT 2025 application form. The authorities conduct the SMEAT entrance exam in multiple cycles.

SMEAT Latest News and Updates

The SMEAT 2025 notification is expected to be released in January. Aspirants willing to get admitted to Srishti Manipal Institute have to appear for the SMEAT entrance exam 2025. 

SMEAT exam result 2025 for each round will be released separately. Candidates will be able to check SMEAT 2025 result date at the official website. The candidates have to use the login credentials to check the SMEAT result 2025 in online mode at srishtimanipalinstitute.in. Aspirants who will qualify the entrance exam will further be called to participate in the interview process.

What is SMEAT?

The SMEAT exam contains various admission rounds. Each round of the SMEAT exam is expected to have different question papers. However, each SEAT/ SMEAT question paper have the same number of questions, marking scheme (total marks) as well as difficulty level. SMEAT score is valid for admission only for one academic year.

highlights.value: Srishti Manipal Entrance and Aptitude Test
Srishti Institute of Art Design and Technology

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Before applying for admission, candidates were advised to check SMEAT 2025 eligibility criteria. The eligibility criteria of SMEAT 2025 will include certain requirements that students must meet to be eligible for admission. The SMEAT eligibility criteria 2025 vary for each program. The applicants to go through the SMEAT eligibility criteria carefully based on their choice of programme.

SMEAT UG Eligibility Criteria 

SMEAT UG eligibility criteria state that applicants must have passed any one of the below-mentioned exams:

  • High School Diploma (USA/Canada)

  • NSQF Certification Level IV completed

  • State Board Of Technical Education- Diploma

  • National or International Boards- CBSE/ISC/IB/AICE/A Level

  • State Boards, Junior College, Intermediate, HSSC, PUC, Senior Secondary

  • National Institute of open schooling (NIOS), New Delhi- Senior Secondary

SMEAT PG Eligibility Criteria 

Candidates can below check SMEAT eligibility criteria as per previous year. 

SMEAT M.Des Eligibility Criteria

Candidates must have fulfilled at least one of the following educational requirements:

  • Attained Level 8 NSQF Certification in a relevant industry sector.
  • Completed a three-year undergraduate degree plus a one-year Postgraduate Diploma Program (PGDP) from a recognized university, either national or international.
  • Earned a four-year undergraduate degree from a recognized university, either national or international.
  • Obtained a five-year undergraduate degree from a professional institute.

 SMEAT M.A Eligibility Criteria

Candidates must have completed at least one of the following educational milestones:

  • Achieved Level 8 NSQF Certification in an applicable industry sector.
  • Graduated with a three-year undergraduate degree, including a three-year Bachelor of Vocation (B.Voc.) degree, from a recognized university, either national or international.
  • Finished a three-year undergraduate degree and a one-year Postgraduate Diploma Program (PGDP) from a recognized university, either national or international.
  • Completed a four-year undergraduate degree from a recognized university, either national or international.
  • Earned a five-year undergraduate degree from a professional institute.

application_process.html_content:
The SMEAT 2025 application form will be released in January. The SMEAT 2025 registration notification will be made available on the official website - srishtimanipalinstitute.in. The applicants have to fill out the SMEAT 2025  application form before the deadline.  Before processing the SMEAT application, the applicants are supposed to make an application fee payment which is non-refundable. The details of the application fee will be provided in the official brochure. Also, have to upload the scanned documents required.

To get the registration form, applicants is required to click on the online link. They have to register online and download the form.

Step 2- Fill out the registration form

  • Address

  • DOB

Candidates should mention their names clearly on the backside of the DD.

exam_name: NID DAT - NID Design Aptitude Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The National Institute of Design released the NID 2025 application form at admissions.nid.edu.  The NID DAT 2025 application form start date is September 3, 2024. Candidates interested in pursuing the design programmes at NID can fill the application form in online mode only.

NID entrance exam will be conducted in two stages: Design Aptitude test prelims and Design Aptitude test mains. NID DAT 2025 prelims entrance exam will be conducted on January 5, 2025. NID exam date 2025 has been released through the official brochure at admissions.nid.edu. 

Candidates are advised to check the NID eligibility criteria 2025 before filling the application form. Candidates need to meet the eligibility criteria specified by the NID authorities such as academic qualification and age limit specified. Candidates who will complete the registration process will be able to access the NID DAT 2025 admit card by using their login credentials such as registered mail id and password. 

NID DAT 2025 Latest News and Updates

NID 2025 notification is out. Aspirants should keep checking admissions.nid.edu to view the NID notification 2025 where the important dates are available.  

NID offers B.Des and M.Des programmes with a duration of 4 years and 2.5 years respectively. NID DAT B.Des prelims exam is conducted in pen and paper based test. NID DAT question paper will be in english language only. Candidates who will qualify the NID DAT prelims exam will be eligible for the DAT mains examination. The main objective of the NID DAT exam is to assess the candidate's knowledge, skills and behavioural abilities. 

Along with the declaration of NID Mains result 2025, the authorities will also begin the counselling process. The NID counselling 2025 will begin with the registration process, followed by submission of campus and course preference, documents verification and payment of admission fee. 

About NID DAT Entrance Exam

The NID Design Aptitude Test (DAT) exam is a national level exam conducted by the National Institute of Design. NID entrance exam 2025 serves as a gateway for the students aspiring to pursue a career in fashion design and technology programmes offered by the institute. NID offers various undergraduate and postgraduate programmes such as Bachelor of Design (BDes),and Master of Design (M.Des).

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates interested in pursuing the B.Des and M.Des programmes at NID should meet the eligibility criteria set by the institute.  The eligibility criteria of NID DAT for B.Des, and M.Des programs ensure that candidates meet the educational qualifications necessary for pursuing design education at undergraduate and postgraduate levels. 

NID DAT eligibility criteria for B.Des

BDes NID eligibility criteria as per previous year has been updated below. 

Educational qualification 

Applicants have to complete their HSC from any stream from a recognised board such as CBSE, IB, ICSE or equivalent. 

Other additional qualifications

  • Applicants have to pass a 10+2 pattern from a state or central board such as  recognised by the AIU, or pre university examination under board or university recognised by AIU . OR

  • Applicants have to complete their HSC from any stream from a recognised board such as CBSE, IB, ICSE or equivalent. 

Age limit

As per previous year NID DAT age limit, candidates need to have at least 20 years before the specified date to be eligible for NID admissions.  However, the age relaxation of three will be available for reserved category students. 

NID DAT eligibility criteria for M.Des

Candidates can check the NID eligibility criteria for MDes courses. 

Educational Qualifications

  • Candidates need to hold a bachelor's degree of 4 years after 12th standard from a recognised institute or university.

  • Students need to pursue a full time diploma of 4 years duration in design, arts, fine arts, applied arts and architecture. 

  • Applicants must pass 3 years bachelors degree in any specialisation from a recognised board

  • Students appearing in the final year of the bachelors exam and not issued the certificate are also eligible. But the candidate should produce their certificate before the specified date mentioned by the authorities. 

Age limit

As per previous year NID age limit, Candidates belonging to the general and general EWS category born on after July 1, 1993 are eligible for the exam. Reserved category candidates will get the age relaxation of three years and five years of age relaxation for PwD category.

about_exam.description:

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
Pearl Academy exam pattern 2025 published by the authorities on its official website - pearlacademy.com. Pearl Academy entrance exam will be conducted in two stages - written test and personal interview. Pearl Academy written exam consists of General Proficiency Test (GPT) + Design Aptitude Test (DAT). After appearing for the written test , candidates need to attend a personal interview. Candidates can submit their portfolio in the personal interview. The duration of the Pearl Academy written exam is 90 mins and the interview will be conducted for 30 mins. Candidates can check the Pearl Academy 2025 exam pattern. 

Stage 1 - Written Admission Test GPT and DAT

GPT: General Proficiency Test, commonly known as GPT, and students will be given 1 hour to complete it. Candidates will be scrutinized based on different parameters such as Quantitative Ability, Data Interpretation, Basic Mathematics, Logical Reasoning, the English language, etc.

DAT: The next exam is the Design Aptitude Test (DAT), and the duration of the entrance test is 30 minutes. Their aptitude for the power of observation & imagination, communication skills, sensitivity to the environment, creativity, drawing and design ability, etc. will be judged from this test.

MAT: Media Aptitude Test (MAT) assesses a media school candidate's aptitude for creative thinking, visual expression, command of the language, and power of observation.

Stage 2 - Candidates have to appear for a Personal Interview after the examination to showcase their portfolio and in the case of design streams, to undergo a material handling skill test.

exam_name: SEED - Symbiosis Entrance Exam for Design

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
SEED 2025: Symbiosis Institute of Design (SID) has started SEED 2025 registrations at sid.edu.in. Aspirants willing to apply for Symbiosis BDes admission can fill the online application form till December 25. Candidates aspiring to pursue the design programme at SID need to appear and qualify the SEED entrance exam. SEED 2025 exam will be held on January 12, 2025 in online mode. 

Aspirants seeking admission to SID need to meet the SEED eligibility criteria set by the authorities. Students who have passed 10+2 exam from any stream or equivalent or 10+3 diploma with 50% (45% for reserved category like SC/ST) recognised or approved by the state board of technical education are eligible for applying for SEED exam 2025.

Candidates who submit the SEED 2025 application form successfully will be able to download the SEED 2025 admit card from January 2. Candidates will be able to download the SEED hall ticket 2025 by using their email ID and password. Candidates will not be allowed to the SEED exam centre 2025 without the admit card. Candidates need to strictly follow the instructions mentioned on the SEED 2025 hall ticket.  

The SEED 2025 exam consists of 60 questions to be answered within a duration of 60 minutes. SEED exam pattern includes multiple formats such multiple choice questions, matching, fill-in-the-blanks, image-based, and comprehension-based queries. The SEED Syllabus covers Visual Sensitivity and Judgement, observational abilities, perceptual and reasoning abilities, problem-solving skills, and basic knowledge of Logic of Science & Mathematics, Craft and Culture, Art & Design, and Environment.

The authorities will declare the SEED 2025 result on its official website -sid.edu.in. The SEED result 2025 will be announced on January 17. Candidates who will be appearing for the SEED exam can check their result by using the login credentials such as email Id and password. Qualified candidates need to appear for the SEED portfolio review and personal interaction (PRPI) round. The SEED PRPI admit card will be issued to the candidates by the authorities on March 21, 2025. Candidates need to appear for the PRPI on the specified dates. The authorities will release the SEED final merit list on April 21, 2025. Selected candidates need to pay the SEED admission fees to attain the seat at SID. 

About SEED 2025 exam 

Symbiosis Institute of Design (Deemed University) will conduct the SEED exam. SEED full form stands for Symbiosis entrance exam for design. SEED exam 2025 serves as a gateway for various undergraduate design programmes offered by SID.  SEED aims to identify and select candidates who possess the creativity, aptitude, and skills necessary to excel in the field of design. SEED evaluates the candidates creative aptitude and skills to pursue the design education and adaptability to the situation.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:

Candidates are advised to check the SEED 2025 eligibility criteria before filling the SEED 2025 application form. Candidates can check the eligibility criteria of SEED 2025 provided below:

  • Students who passed their 10+2 from any stream (Science, Commerce, Arts, etc) or equivalent are eligible 

  • Applicants who qualified the 10+3 diploma with minimum 50% marks or 45% for reserved category approved by the State Board of Technical Education. 

  • Candidates who completed the final examination of 10+2 grade or 10+3 diploma programmes provided the results of the examination must be declared by June of the admission year or earlier. 

Additional Qualifications 

  • Candidates includes necessary skills for design education, creative aptitude, and adaptability to professional demands

  • Candidates possessing portfolios will be given more preference.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Candidates preparing for the SEED entrance exam need to have the strategy to excel in the exam.  Candidates need to make a strategic planning with some time frame that will help in cracking the exam with a good score. Here are some of the preparation tips for the SEED exam that helps the candidates to prepare efficiently. 

  • Start the preparation with a clear plan of study. Sketch out the goals and topics, section  and allocate the time accordingly. 

  • Make the regular practice of mock tests, and sample papers. Analyse the strong and weak areas and concentrate on the weak areas and practice on strong areas. 

  • Understand the exam pattern of SEED and syllabus by covering the all tropics and sections 

  • Review and revise the already prepared topics and sections regularly.

  • Take enough rest and stay healthy while preparing for the exam.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
SID specifies the SEED 2025 exam pattern on its official website - sid.edu.in. about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
MIT Institute of Design announced the MIT DAT 2025 application dates at its official website - mitid.edu.in. Aspirants planning to get admitted to MITID can fill the MIT DAT 2025 registration form online. Candidates need to submit the MIT DAT application form 2025 before the deadline. The MIT DAT 2025 application form last date is February 28. Candidates seeking admission to MIT Institute of Design will have to appear and qualify for the MIT DAT 2025 exam. The authorities released the MIT DAT exam date. The MIT DAT entrance exam will be conducted on April 6, 2025.  

MIT DAT 2025 will be conducted for the duration of 3 hours at various test centres across India. (Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Bhopal, Chandigarh, Chennai, Cochin (Kochi), Delhi, Goa, Hyderabad, Indore, Jaipur, Kolkata, Lucknow, Mumbai, Nagpur, Pune). Students are advised to check the MIT DAT eligibility criteria, syllabus and exam pattern beforehand. 

Aspirants who register for the MIT Pune entrance exam 2025 will be able to download the hall ticket in 2nd or 3rd week of March. MIT admit card 2025 is an important document without which no aspirant will be allowed to appear for the MIT DAT entrance exam. 

Candidates who qualify the MIT DAT entrance exam 2025 will be called to participate in the studio test and personal interview. Further, candidates who qualify for studio test and personal interview need to attend at respective campuses, which completes the process of selection.

MIT Design Aptitude Test or MIT DAT is conducted jointly for admissions of B.Des & M.Des programs at MIT Institute of Design (MIT ID) Pune, MITID Indore (Avantika University-Ujjain), and MITID Shillong (MIT University Shillong). Candidates who are shortlisted based on the performance in MIT DAT exam, studio test and personal interview will be allotted seat in MITID campuses. Aspirants should note that the MIT Institute of Design Pune, Avantika University Ujjain, and MIT University Shillong will have their separate merit list of shortlisted candidates.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:

exam_name: ADAT - ADYPDC Design Aptitude Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
ADAT 2024: The Ajeenkya D Y Patil University (ADYPU)  released the final merit list on April 25, 2024. The dates for portfolio evaluation were from April 22-23 and updating the portfolio was from April 18 to 20, 2024. The University closed the second stage of the registration process for the ADAT entrance exam for the 2024-25 session. The ADAT application form submission was closed on April 6, 2024.

The ADAT 2024 was conducted on April 13 and 14, 2024. The duration of the ADAT was 3 hours (10 am to 1 pm). The qualifier list of ADAT was declared on April 18, 2024. Students who cleared the ADAT had to update their portfolio from April 18 to April 20 2024, in both online and offline modes. The portfolio evaluation was conducted from April 22 to 23, 2024. Students who cleared the portfolio evaluation had to appear in the personal interview. The final merit list of the ADAT entrance test was declared on April 25, 2024.

The Ajeenkya D Y Patil University (ADYPU) concluded the initial phase of the ADAT application process on December 20, 2023. The ADAT 2024 examination, lasting three hours, took place on January 6, 2024. The list of qualifiers was announced on January 10, 2024. Students were allowed to update their portfolios until January 12, 2024. Portfolio evaluations began on January 16, 2024, and those who passed were invited for a personal interview. The final merit list for the ADAT entrance test was released on January 22, 2024.

ADAT 2024 Admission Process:

  • Check the Eligibility

  • Apply Online

  • Pay application fee

  • Complete the Admission Form

  • Submit Form

  • Appear for ADAT 

  • Check qualifiers list 

  • Update Portfolio 

  • Portfolio Evaluation

  • Personal Interview

  • Admission Offer

  • Acceptance of Admission Form

  • Check Final Merit List

What is ADAT?

ADAT is commonly known as ADYPU Design Aptitude Test. It is a two-stage design entrance test that consists of a prelims exam and a mains exam. The prelims exam held on January 6, 2024, in pen and paper mode in various cities across India. The duration of the prelims exam was 3 hours (10 am to 1 pm). The mains exam consisted of portfolio evaluation and personal interview, which commenced from January 16, 2024.

ADAT is conducted to assess candidates’ knowledge, skill, and behavioural abilities. ADYPU admission is based entirely on candidates’ performance in ADAT.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The eligibility criteria of the ADYPU Design Aptitude Test 2024 specify the academic qualifications that candidates must fulfill to appear for the ADAT 2024.

Candidates must have passed their 12th class in any discipline (Science, Commerce, or Arts) or have a 3-year full-time diploma. This remains unchanged from the previous year.

Candidates must also meet the specific eligibility criteria for the programs they wish to apply for, as given in the table below. The programs are offered by the School of Design under ADYPU. Candidates must also appear for the ADAT entrance exam, which consists of a prelims exam, a campus studio test, and a personal interview.

application_process.html_content:
The Phase 2 application form for the ADAT entrance test for the 2024-25 session was available online until April 6. The ADYPU Design Aptitude Test application fee is Rs. 2000, which is non-refundable. Payment can be made through a demand draft in favor of “Registrar, ADYPU”, payable at Pune.

The demand draft should be accompanied by an admission form and submitted online. Candidates seeking to appear for the entrance test can follow the steps below to fill out the ADAT 2024 application form:

  • Step 1 – Candidates have to click on the registration link. 

  • Step 2 – Fill in the personal details, such as candidate’s name, father’s or mother’s name, address, mobile number, date of birth, email, gender, nationality, and choice of course. 

  • Step 3 – Candidates have to fill in the academic record such as examination passed or appeared, name of the school or college, board, and year of passing or appearance. 

  • Step 4 – Upload your picture and payment receipt/scan copy of DD/cheque (maximum 96dpi in resolution), and mention the date and place. 

  • Step 5 – Tick on ‘I Accept’ and click on the ‘Submit’ button.

admit_card.html_content:
Ajeenkya D Y Patil University (ADYPU) issued the admit card for ADAT 2024 in online mode. Candidates could download their ADAT 2024 admit card by visiting the received link on their registered email id.

Here’s how to download the ADYPU DAT 2024 admit card:

  • Login to your registered email id.

  • Find the received link to the ADAT 2024-25 admit card.

  • Then, click the download admit card button.

  • It will automatically download in pdf format.

  • Take a printout of the ADAT 2024-25 hall ticket for your future use.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The exam primarily consists of multiple-choice questions that test various aspects of a candidate’s design aptitude. The total marks for the exam are expected to be 100, providing a thorough evaluation of the candidate’s abilities.

The duration of the ADAT exam was for 3 hours. Candidates have the flexibility to take the exam in either online or offline mode. This ensures that all candidates, regardless of their geographical location or access to resources, have an equal opportunity to appear for the exam.

It’s important for candidates to familiarise themselves with this exam pattern well in advance of the test date. This will help them understand what to expect on the day of the exam and plan their time management strategies accordingly.

exam_name: SOFT CET - School of Fashion Technology Common Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
SOFT CET 2025 will be conducted by MKSSS's School of Fashion Technology for admission to UG, PG, and Diploma courses. Candidates willing to appear for SOFT CET 2025 can apply online at soft.ac.in tentatively in February. Moreover, the SOFT CET exam 2025 will be conducted in May. 

Admission to MKSSS's School of Fashion Technology will be done based on the candidate's performance in General Ability Test, Studio Test / Group Discussions and Personal Interview. All the candidates must take all three tests. Before applying for the entrance exam, candidates need to satisfy the SOFT CET 2025 eligibility criteria. Candidates who have passed Class 12th or have a minimum 2-year Diploma Degree with Class 10th are eligible to apply online. 

Students who qualify the entrance exam will be included in the SOFT CET merit list 2025. Students who will be included in the merit list of SOFT CET 2025 will have to confirm their admission before the deadline. Candidates can check the SOFT CET results by using their login credential such as email ID and password. 

What is SOFT CET 2025?

School Of Fashion Technology Common Entrance Test or SOFT CET is held by MKSSS's School of Fashion Technology to provide admission to various Undergraduate and Postgraduate Diploma Design courses. The SOFT CET exam is given at the university level once a year. The exam is divided into three stages: online test, studio test/group discussions, and personal interviews.

highlights.value: School of Fashion Technology Common Entrance Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The authorities will prescribe certain conditions and requirements that every aspirant need to meet. To ensure their eligibility for the exam, candidates must be fully aware of the SOFT CET 2025 eligibility criteria. The following are the eligibility criteria for SOFT CET details as per previous year:

SOFT CET Eligibility Criteria 

Programme

Eligibility Criteria

Eligibility Criteria for Undergraduate Courses

  • Candidates must have passed on their 12th-grade examination from a recognised board.

  • Candidates with a two-year full-time diploma from the Maharashtra State Board of Technical Education (MSBTE) or the State Government Technical Education are also eligible for SOFT CET 2024.

  • To take the test, NRI and international candidates must have an equivalent certificate from the Association of Indian Universities (AIU).

Postgraduate studies Criteria for Eligibility

  • To be eligible, applicants must have completed their graduation in any field.

application_process.html_content:
MKSSS's School of Fashion Technology will soon release the application form of SOFT CET 2025. To apply for the SOFT CET 2025, candidates will have to fill and submit the online application form before the deadline. Only those candidates who fill SOFT CET 2025 registration form before the deadline will be allowed to appear for the entrance exam. 

Documents Required for SOFT CET Registration 2025

Every candidate who applies for SOFT CET 2025 should keep the following documents with their application:

  • 10th-grade mark sheet (mandatory for all programmes)

  • Address Verification (mandatory for all programmes)

  • Candidates must submit a scanned copy of their Class 12th Result for the UG course and a copy of their 12th and Graduation mark sheet for the PG course.

Steps to fill SOFT CET application form 2025

Applicants who wish to take the SOFT CET 2024 should complete the application form which will be available on the official website.

  • Visit School of Fashion Technology (SOFT) website and click on the Registration Link.

  • Candidates must register with a valid email address or mobile phone number and carefully fill out all the information requested on the application form.

  • Upload all required information in JPEG format, and ensure the uploaded photograph is clear.

  • Once the application form has been completed, click the "submit" button.

  • Keep a printout of the application form for future reference.

preparation_tips.html_content:
• Candidates must be familiar with the syllabus and attempt to solve all previous year's question papers or SOFT CET sample papers to understand the pattern of questions asked. The Question Papers can be found on SOFT's official website.

  • Participants should be capable of using their time wisely so they do not become exhausted while studying. A proper schedule must be created and followed.

  • It's vital that learners take enough breaks while studying to keep their minds calm and composed.

  • Yoga can also be used to manage stress.

  • Consume a well-balanced diet as well.

admit_card.html_content:
Aspirants who complete the registration process before the deadline will be issued hall tickets. On the day of the examination, candidates have to carry their admit card, a passport-sized photo, and a valid ID. Candidates were advised to check all details mentioned in the SOFT CET admit card 2025 and contact the authorities in case of any error or mistakes. 

Steps to Download the SOFT CET 2025 Admit Card:

  • Visit the official website at soft.ac.in.

  • Click on the 'download admit card' button.

  • Enter the correct username, password, and security code, then click 'login'.

  • On the screen, the admit card will be displayed. Save the soft copy and print a copy for future reference.

Details Mentioned on SOFT CET Admit Card 2025:

The following information will be available in the SOFT CET hall ticket 2025.

  • Candidate Name

  • Application number 

  • Examination schedule 

  • Address of the candidate 

  • Photograph and Signature of the candidate 

  • General instructions.

counselling_process.html_content:
Counselling will begin immediately after the results are announced. Candidates who pass the Common Entrance Examination will be eligible to take the SOFT CET 2025 counselling.

  • Following the announcement of the results, the SOFT CET authority will publish a list of Merit Rank Holders who must report to the institute on a specific date with the required documents.

  • The authority will begin providing counselling tentatively in the last week of June 2024.

  • All candidates who wish to be admitted to the institute must send a confirmation email to admission@soft.ac.in with a CC to admin@soft.ac.in, failing which the seat will be automatically given to the waitlisted candidate.

  • Following receipt of the confirmation email, applicants will be called in to complete the admission procedure in accordance with the academic calendar posted on the official website.

  • Candidates must report to the institute with all required documents and certificates. The organizing body will verify these documents and certificates.

  • They must then pay the tuition fees associated with their courses.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
Aspirants who are going to appear for the SOFT CET 2025 should check the exam pattern beforehand. With the help of SOFT CET exam pattern 2025, candidates can know details such as duration of the paper, types of questions asked, mode and much more. 

  • Mode: The SOFT CET 2025 will be held online as well as offline mode.

  • Question Type: The Entrance Exam will include a General Ability Test, a Studio Test, Group Discussions, and a Personal Interview. All candidates are required to take all three tests.

  • Number of Questions: Online Test - 60 Marks, Studio Test / Group Discussion 140 Marks, and Personal Interview  (Portfolio + Statement of Purpose)- 50 Marks from the syllabus covered in the qualifying exam. 

  • Marking Scheme: Candidates will receive one mark for each correct answer, with no negative marking for incorrect answers. As a result, candidates are advised to attempt all questions and not leave any unanswered.

  • Medium: The language of the question paper of the SOFT CET 2025 will be English.

Parul University will soon announce the PUDAT 2025 dates at paruluniversity.ac.in. Parul University Design Aptitude Test (PU DAT) for admission to design courses. Candidates interested in applying for the Parul University Design Aptitude Test (PU DAT) 2025 have to submit an online application form. PUDAT registration 2025 date is yet to be announced.

It’s crucial for applicants to familiarise themselves with the eligibility criteria for the B.Des at Parul University before applying. For the B.Des programme, candidates must have completed their 10+2 from any stream with English subject from a Statutory Examining Authority. For the M.Des programme, candidates must have completed their graduation from a recognised university.

PU DAT 2025 syllabus include topics from sections like  Design, Logical and Analytical Reasoning, Critical Thinking, General Knowledge. Parul Institute of Design (PID) does not issue admit cards for the PU DAT. Instead, candidates will receive their login credentials for the online DAT via Email/SMS/Call. The DAT will be conducted on the World Assessment Council (WAC) online platform.

After the PU DAT application form is successfully submitted, candidates will receive a confirmation email. Candidates are required to take the DAT written exam. Based on the scores from the PU DAT exam, candidates will be invited to submit their portfolios. The final stage involves a personal interview. Parul University will compile a final list of successful candidates, which is based on the total weighted scores from each stage of the admission process.

What is PU DAT? 

The Parul University Design Aptitude Test (PU DAT) is an entrance exam conducted by Parul University for admission to design courses. The PU DAT notification has already been released on the official website of the university.

Admissions to Parul University are based on a candidate’s performance in the PU DAT examination. After the scores are obtained, candidates will be invited to submit their portfolios and subsequently attend an interview. It’s important to note that all these stages are conducted online. 

Parul University Design Specializations

Parul University provides a wide range of specializations in both the Bachelor of Design (B.Des) programmes. The University offers specialisations in the following areas:

The Footwear Design & Development Institute will release the FDDI AIST notification 2025 on its official website -  fddiindia.com. FDDI AIST 2025 notification is expected to be released in October, 2024.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Footwear Design & Development Institute will publish the eligibility criteria of FDDI AIST on its official website - fddiindia.com. Candidates seeking admission for undergraduate and postgraduate programmes need to meet the prescribed eligibility requirements of FDDI AIST 2025. Interested candidates can check the FDDI AIST eligibility criteria 2025 from the following: 

For B.Des programme:

Candidates who are interested in undergraduate programmes such as B.Des need to meet the following criteria

  • Age limit: Candidates should have an age limit of 25 years as on July 1 of the admission year. 

  • Educational Qualification:

    •  Candidates must pass 10+2 in any discipline from any recognised university. 

    • Candidates who clear 10+2 from a recognised board or university as per Association of Indian Universities. 

    • Candidates must pass a minimum five subjects in School Examination conducted by National Open School.

    • Candidates who completed their 3 years diploma approved by AICTE after Class X from a State or Union Territory Board of Technical Education.

For M.Des programmes 

Candidates aspiring to get seat in postgraduate programmes like M.Des in Footwear Design & Production and M.Des in fashion design must satisfy the following eligibility criteria:

  • M.Des in Fashion Design: Students who have a bachelor's degree in any discipline from a recognized Institute or University in India.  
  • M.Des in Footwear Design & Production: Students who passed the bachelor's degree in any stream from a recognized university or institute in India. A bridge programme with relevant subjects may be offered alongside the M.Des. for students without a design background.

Age limit: There is no limit specified by the authorities for post graduation courses

preparation_tips.html_content:
Preparing for the FDDI AIST (Footwear Design & Development Institute All India Selection Test) requires focused effort and strategic planning. Here are some essential tips to help to crack the exam:

  • Candidates must familiarise themselves with the exam pattern and syllabus. With the help of exam pattern, candidates can know the sections, number of questions, and marking scheme to plan for the exam preparation accordingly.

  • Create a study schedule that allocates sufficient time for each subject and balance the study session to cover all topics. 

  • Focus on basics in each section like analytical ability, verbal ability, Comprehension, grammar, general awareness, current affairs, design aptitude and business Aptitude. Review basic concepts and practice problems regularly.

  • Practice previous years' question papers and mock tests tounderstand the progress and identify areas needing improvement. This helps in familiarising with the exam format and enhances time management skills.

  • General Awareness is crucial. Stay updated with current events, especially those related to the footwear, design, and fashion industries. Follow news, read magazines, and watch relevant documentaries.

  • During practice sessions, work on improving your speed and accuracy. Learn to prioritise questions and manage time effectively during the exam.

  • Plan regular revision sessions by making concise notes for quick revision closer to the exam date.

  • Maintain a positive attitude and stay calm during the exam. Trust your preparation and approach each question methodically.

  • Take proper rest, nutrition, and exercise to keep mind and body in optimal condition for peak performance.

Before applying for GLS DAT 2025, candidates are advised to check the eligibility criteria as laid down by the authorities. Based on the marks obtained by students in GLS DAT 2025 and interaction, the final shortlisting will be done based on which offer letters are issued.
